results.title: EPS Improvement Act of 2017
results.committees: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) EPS Improvement Act of 2017 (Sec. 2) This bill amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to exclude from energy conservation standards for external power supplies any power supply circuit, driver, or device designed to power light-emitting diodes or to power ceiling fans using direct current motors. The Department of Energy may prescribe energy conservation standards for that equipment no earlier than one year after the date on which a test procedure has been prescribed by using its authority to improve the energy efficiency of electric motors and pumps and other industrial equipment.

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text of measure as passed: CR H571-572)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 518.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H571-572)
Mr. Upton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
